alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford; Dubois; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Orange; Perry; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 2:28PM EST until January 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM EST /9 PM CST/ THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST /9 AM CST/ SUNDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow showers and flurries will continue through the late afternoon hours. Additional snowfall amounts of a quarter to three quarters of an inch will be possible. In addition, gusty northwest winds of 25-30 mph will result in the blowing and drifting of snow in areas. These gusty winds will also result in wind chills running in the low single digits this afternoon and into the 5 to 15 -degree range tonight. Wind chills during the day on Saturday will warm into the lower single digits before dropping back into the zero to -10 range Saturday night. * WHERE...Southern Indiana and north central Kentucky. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM EST /9 PM CST/ this evening to 10 AM EST /9 AM CST/ Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slick road conditions, especially on secondary and untreated roads. The gusty northwest winds will cause blowing of snow which may result in visibility reductions for short periods of time.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Indiana, for Indiana Road Conditions please visit http://pws.trafficwise.org In Kentucky, for Kentucky Road Conditions please visit http://goky.ky.gov
